item.title: शिक्षा - उच्चारणे ध्वनिरक्षणे च सूचनाः Reciting and Recording- tips
item.description: Short url : https://rebrand.ly/mbh-recording-standards Good pronunciation: Most important varNa-level pronunciation (English) Clearly distinguish न vs ण, स vs श vs ष, अल्पप्राण (त) vs महाप्राण (थ), थ vs ध, आ vs अ (esp in the end, like in उवाच), etc.. But don’t overcompensate! Overemphasis on mahAprANa-s etc.. harms the natural melody. Don’t elongate final vyanjana-s. “इदम् अन्यत्तु भगवन्” इत्यत्रान्तिमनकारो “भगवन्न्अ(३)” इतिवन् न श्रूयेत। There is a pervasive practice of Visarga pronunciation in Karnataka state, as like in the place of pronunciation of the words “पराक्रमः” and “विक्रमः”, it sounds like “पराक्रमहा” “विक्रमहा” which gives opposite meaning (like one who destroyes valour is “पराक्रमहा” and one who destroys the courage is “विक्रमहा”) to the listeners.
